Posts.Title: Wouldn't you get away from cancer if you could? CoolBreeze soleil505

Posts.Content: Sep 16, 2018 11:48PM Druanne wrote: I was wondering what this is that I've been feeling! I am only 3 weeks out and my armpits burn and my breasts feel sunburned. If a hair or the tip of my shirt touches in between my implants near the top.....it is MADDENING!! Like a cross between a tickle and pain. Also, I have a grape sized lump under my right armpit that hurts. My BS says it may be axial breast tissue (ultrasound showed it was not fluid filled) or got clumped somehow when the implant was attached. She said she wants me to finish healing before we address it. I had a skin/nipple sparing bilateral mastectomy. I was supposed to have tissue expanders because my left breast had been radiated 7 years prior but I woke up with implants. I am happy about that...and am very grateful.....I wasn't prepared for this burning. ALSO......I am having this thing.....if I scratch a mosquito bite on my wrist or leg or something similar......I get a sharp pain in my breast/s. Is this because the nerves are all messed up?? My fiance keeps telling me to take Tylenol but Tylenol doesn't touch this pain! It is not excruciating for me but it is very unpleasant and uncomfortable. I may try some of the creams mentioned in this thread! Thank you! Hugs for you all. <3
Posts.Title: Hypersensitive skin/nerves after mastectomy az2017 Silverpullet

Posts.Content: May 1, 2012 12:11AM Druanne wrote: Just wanna give you big hugs.......I was very fearful as well when I found out.......and thought for sure I had two weeks to live.......once you find out what it is and make a treatment plan, if it is cancer, you will feel so much better :) and if it is NOT cancer just think of all this time you have spent so distraught and stressed out <3.... After I met my surgeon........he was so in control.......and he had a plan.......and I felt so much better........please try to relax and find some peace........I told myself while I waiting for my results......it either IS cancer, or it is NOT......and worrying is not going to help or change anything........I had my biopsy right before Thanksgiving and had to wait for an entire week for results......I vowed to try not to think about it or let it affect my holiday because there wasn't a thing I could do about it anyway........so after turkey my daughter & I had a "dance party" in the basement.....there are so many women on this forum living with all kinds of breast cancers in various stages........let that be calming to you.....there is so much doctors can do these days....do keep coming in here for support........this forum helped me get through the very darkest of days......
Posts.Title: so worried I have breast cancer leelee101 leelee101

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2011 06:27PM Druanne wrote: :( I have big, thick, curly hair down to my butt :(.........I am going to be devastated if/when I have to have chemo........my Mother was a beautician........so I grew up "all about hair".....people know be by my hair...I love my hair....:( My friend who has cut & colored my hair for the last 13 years has always refused to cut it short when I would go off on a crazy tangent wanting to "try something new" because she knew I would start balling the moment the hair fell to the floor........I am ever so grateful for that.......Now however...she promised to help me when the time comes...(bless her)....We are going to have a "hair day" cutting my hair into different styles and stuff...right before I start chemo....saving one long lock :) Today I even thought about maybe giving it to "Locks for Love" I would love to do that!!! :) You are all so amazing and inspiring.........I keep telling myself that it is only hair and that I will be thankful just to be alive <3 <3 <3 <3

Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed- Get Prepared sas-schatzi Amyadipose

Posts.Content: Dec 1, 2011 10:56AM Druanne wrote: sas-schatzi: Thank you so much for all the great information and taking time to write!!!! I feel so much better after my appointment last night.....my OB GYN delivered the news to me in such a terrible way, I felt like I had weeks to live....The Dr. I met last night was so wonderful in explaining things and even pointed out some "positive" things about my tumor.....if there can be such a thing :) He said my cells were not aggressive, were not into the blood vessel sample they took......receptive to hormones........and small in size........I thought it was HUGE and was gonna grow even BIGGER over night!! It is hard not to think the absolute WORST!! We talked about all kinds of things......Next step is an ultrasound on my right breast to check it out (my mammograms show nothing because of dense breast tissue)........and a biopsy on a lymph node under my left armpit :(......Having these things done Monday.......They are connecting me with an oncologist right away so I can meet her and we can have time to discuss the many therapy options/scenarios after surgery........I am still scared beyond comprehension and cannot believe this is happening to me.... but at least I have somewhat of a better understanding of things and the start of a plan of action...........I am so very happy I have found you all and this forum......gives me hope........and a little bit of sanity during this crazy time in my life.........<3 Druanne

Two appointments even changed times already! One thing that is pretty cool, I just received an activiation code for a website called "MyChart" has anyone else heard of it? All of your records and appointments are all right there! I am going to print hard copies out of everything and put it in my binder. Feeling ok today......gonna have a weekend......I even feel like Christmas shopping which I am finding STRANGE! Hugs back at cha!
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed- Get Prepared sas-schatzi Amyadipose

Posts.Content: Feb 17, 2012 11:31PM Druanne wrote: You are NOT over reacting!! I went completely CRAZY until I met with my surgeon......he told me all about my specific cancer.....the good and the bad about it...........and we made a plan of action.....I felt SO MUCH better after talking with him......it was like night and day!.....It was around Christmas time.....he told me.......you can put your tree up and go out and buy gifts........you have many more Christmas' left in you :D :D :D The day I found out I had cancer was a rollercoaster of emotions........that evening I was crying and feeling like I had two weeks to live........and angry....and alone......and disgusted with the "thing" in my breast and wanting it OUT.....just like you............My husband said to me that night......"I guess I am going to have to do a little research so I can learn about these STAGES you are going to go through"............say WHAT???? Lots of hugs for you..... It DOES get better with more knowledge and a plan of action <3
Posts.Title: What's next? seabeal sandik

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2012 01:43PM Druanne wrote: Thanks Marie & Robin! Can't wait to find out the results this Monday or Tuesday......if benign then it is off to radiation for me!!! :D Keeping my fingers crossed! guineamom I hope biospy results are B-9!!!! <3 Very similar things happening with you and I......the mass they biopsied yesterday was indeed on the MRI........but the one I could actually feel was not on the MRI or found by US!! SO WEIRD!!! This is what my MRI said about the mass in my left breast: In the inferomedial aspect of the left breast at approximately 7-8 o'clock, there is a 10 x 6 mm, well circumscribed but mildly lobulated, mildly enhancing nodule which has predominately type 2 or plateau characteristics. This appears to have a small fatty notch and most likely is an intramammary lymph node but findings are overall indeterminate. I do not see any other areas of abnormal enhancement in the left breast. * most likely intramammary lymph node based on its morphology with type 2 enhancement kinetics. Recommendation will be for a second look ultrasound as this was not seen on the initial ultrasound and, if identified, ultrasound-guided core biopsy would be recommended to exclude malignancy, although favor that this is benign and most likely an intramammary lymph node.

Posts.Content: Jan 28, 2012 10:09AM Druanne wrote: I am being poked and prodded too.......:/ Just keep telling myself that they are just being thorough.......Felt a lump in my left breast, scheduled a mammo......have dense breasts so mammo didn't show anything.......had an ultrasound.....then a biopsy......learned I had breast cancer......found a lump on right side..........ultrasound.......biopsy.......benign YAY!.......Biospy on my lymph node on the left side prior to lumpectomy........no cancer found there! YAY!......Lumpectomy........clear margins.......no cancer in nodes.........YAY!.........felt something in left breast somewhere else :(.........ultrasound.......can't find it.........MRI........finds total DIFFERENT mass......thinking it is just an intramammory lymph node but just to be sure they did another ultrasound yesterday........followed by another biopsy....now waiting for results.....and keeping my sense of humor the whole time :).......made an owie face during the procedure yesterday..........doctor said........oh can you feel that??????? I said........no.......just messin with ya ;)

Posts.Content: Dec 29, 2011 12:26AM - edited Dec 29, 2011 12:29AM by Druanne :( I am so very sorry :( I am standing upon the seashore. A ship at my side spreads her white sails to the morning breeze and starts for the blue ocean. She is an object of beauty and strength, and I stand and watch her until at length she hangs like a speck of white cloud just where the sea and sky come down to meet and mingle with each other. Then some one at my side says: "There! she's gone!" Gone where? Gone from my sight, that is all. She is just as large in the mast and hull and spar as she was when she left my side, and just as able to bear her load of living freight to the place of her destination. Her diminished size is in me, and not in her. And just at that moment, when some one at my side says: "There! she's gone!" there are other eyes that are watching for her coming and other voices ready to take up the glad shout, "There she comes!" Do not stand at my grave and weep; I am not there. I do not sleep. I am a thousand winds that blow. I am the diamond glints on snow. I am the sunlight on ripened grain. I am the gentle autumn rain. When you... awaken in the morning's hush, I am the swift uplifting rush of quiet birds in circled flight. I am the soft stars that shine at night. Do not stand at my grave and cry; I am not there. I did not die.

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2011 09:15PM Druanne wrote: Hi everyone! I see my RO this Friday morning..........says it is going to be a 90 minute appointment!! Wonder what is going to happen!! It is so interesting to me to hear about all the different treatments and scenarios for everyone......some have chemo first then radiation.....others the opposite.......some none and take tamoxifen or herceptin........it is all so crazy if you REALLY start mulling it all over inside your brain!!! Oh and decisions!!! I don't know what my Oncotype score is yet so am waiting on deciding about chemo......I am so afraid of chemo.....but I know there are so many strong women here that have gotten through to the other side!!!! Just rambling now.......sorry :) Time for bed......:) After I finish reading everyone's posts!! ;)
